Text.Text: [Impressed]So you're the one who's been more trouble than a deva in the Abyss?  [Commanding]Throw down your arms and surrender, insignificant thing.  Your journey, however impressive, ends here.

[Assertive and professional]My name is [Share-in-kull]Sherincal, and I lead the Legion of the [kai-MEE-rah]Chimera's forces in this region.  [Threatening]However, I'll not fall as easily as my underling [GUTH'muh]Guthma.
[Explaining]In unimaginable greatness, I am dragon, but in irrevocable shame, I'm also human.

[Upset]If only I could rip that accursed humanity from my soul... [Calmer but stern]that day will come.  [Assuming the player also despises their human side]Could our kind *ever* embrace our human sides, or are we forever tainted?
[Upset]If only I could rip that accursed humanity from my soul... [Calmer]that day *will* come.  [Still upset but assertive]Speak *none* of this again!

[Explaining]We're a growing army of outcasts that all of [Fay-ROON]Faerun will soon have little choice but to reckon with.  [Assuming the player feels similarly]YOU should be fighting *with* us, not *against* us... [Disappointing sigh]but now you must pay for the sibling blood you've spilt.

[Half explaining, half boasting, half holding the player accountable for the evil of humanity]We're a nation of outcasts and hybrids that your kind fears, judges, and banishes to your slave pits, dungeons, and cemeteries.  [Proud, making a sweeping motion with her sword]A new world is dawning, and all of [Fay-ROON]Faerun will soon have little choice but to reckon with us.

[Declaring proudly, as if giving a rehearsed speech]From the Sea of Moving Ice to the High Forest, from the highest peak in the Spine of the World Mountains, to the deepest, most volcanic bowels of the earth, the Legion of the [kai-MEE-rah]Chimera will purge this land of those enemies who seek to deny the sovereignty of our nation.
[Pleased with the player's decision]I assure you you've made the wisest choice in your entire life, my dear.

[Paying her respect to Auril]I wouldn't dare make such a blasphemous claim - only Auril commands them - [Explaining]but they are bound to an agreement with my superiors [ih-ZAIR]Isair and [mah-DAY]Madae.  I'm merely here to make sure said agreement is not jeopardized... [Pausing then slyly referring to the player]by... intrepid wanderers on quests of fame and fortune.

[Regretful]A soldier such as he shouldn't have to die alone and with such dishonor.  [Explaining - her soarsmen are the wyvern companions she flies with]My soarsmen and I were safely delivering him to this temple when he gave struggle and unfortunately fell.

[Quietly talking to herself]A [VUR-beeg]verbeeg leading [foh-MOR-ee-an]fomorians is most interesting...  [Thankful but regretful to the player]I appreciate this information, but it cannot unwind the tension between us.

[Explaining scornfully]I've little of my mother's powers and heritage - caught between two worlds, and accepted by neither.  [Regaining her composure]My human anchor offers me *nothing* but normality.
[Explaining]My necromancers have been using this temple's facilities to devise a way of destroying the human ichor that burns my veins - making me pure, as was meant to be.
[Exlaining]Twin brother and sister [ih-ZAIR]Isair and [mah-DAY]Madae command the Legion of the Chimera from its capitol, the Severed Hand.

[Disappointed]In good faith, I offer you the chance to live your death with honor and dignity, but instead you drag me and my name through the muddy snow?  [Pausing to prepare for battle]My coffers of charity have all run dry.

[Tired and frustrated]We can dance like this until the gods themselves walk the earth, but all that will come of it is softer ice and duller blades.   [Assertive]Simply say my name and succumb to me to end this madness.
[Impressed, but somewhat haughty while explaining]You're a worthy adversary, so I'll offer you an honorable surrender.  Agree to this and I can promise you a quick death.

[Regretful sigh]What else can happen when an unstoppable force collides with an unmovable object?  [Commanding but respectful]To the shores of war then, we shall travel, with valor as our greatest guide.

[Somewhat light-hearted]Yes, the [mocking]indomitable [GOOB-lee-ka]Goublika has fallen!  For a self-professed [mocking]"Liberator of the World's [foh-MOR-ee-an]Fomorian Giants," he offered *little* challenge...
[Pausing to let the humor subside, then serious]They're as children you know, the [foh-MOR-ee-an]fomorians, but under my tutelage they'll become *beautiful* warriors!
You killed Goublika.  Are the fomorian giants working for you now?
Who are you?
What are you?
Why are you here?
Do you command these Aurilites?
Did you drop Captain Yurst to his death?
What's the Legion of the Chimera?
What's the Legion of the Chimera?
What was the Legion of the Chimera?
What was the Legion of the Chimera?
You killed Goublika.  Are the fomorian giants working for you now?
Did I mention that was Goublika you killed?
What are you?
What are you again?
Why are you here?
I forgot the reason why you are here.
Do you command these Aurilites?
Did you say you were the commander of these Aurilites?
Enough talk.  Let's end this now!
Tell me about your human side.
Tell me about your human side.

Did I mention that was Goublika you killed?
What did you say about your human side?
What did you say about your human side?
There's a verbeeg giant in the foothills named Goublika who's leading a hunting party of fomorian giants against you.

StartCutSceneMode()
StartCutScene("41cPriso")
